availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ohio military regiment (U.S.A.). Organized at Camp Corwin, Dayton Ohio, on August 5, 1861. Mustered out October 14, 1864, when recruits were transferred to the 18th Ohio Volunteer Infantry. Commander: Colonel Benjamin F. Smith.

ab.bibl:
"1st Regiment, Ohio Infantry,"Union Ohio VolunteerNPS.gov, Soldiers and Sailors Database, https://www.nps.gov/civilwar/search-battle-units-detail.htm?battleUnitCode=UOH0001RI01, viewed on June 12, 2020.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 100.
